author: jgm
content:
1) are relays able to publish to multiple beacon nodes at the same time?
2) if 1 is yes, then how many relays are configured in this way?

This is such a large change to the flow of blocks through the Ethereum network, I'm very uncomfortable with how quickly this has been pushed through without any ability for larger discussion on the consequences.

because it adds additional delay, intentionally, and because it only returns block at all if own broadcast works, means BNs' broadcast can't function as fallback. but, sure, this "rogue proposer" framing is consistent with general ... productive tension ... inherent in builder API.

author: metachris_
content: The mev-boost-relay codebase supports multiple beacon nodes, and the request is sent in parallel to all of them. Flashbots infra uses 3 beacon node instances.

author: metachris_
content: Happy to have larger discussion on the consequences, but the situation needed an immediate solution, and the only other option would have been to disable relays indefinitely.

author: metachris_
content: Several key stakeholders agreed to this being the prudent immediate next step.

author: metachris_
content: Let's have the conversation about consequences and alternatives!

author: jgm
content:
> the only other option would be to disable relays indefinitely

which I don't see as being a bad solution, at least until it could have been discussed more broadly.  But we are where we are.

author: tersec
content:
> alternatives

I was being a bit flippant above, but, the actual answer is, I think, people seem to want this functionality enough that disabling relays indefinitely was/is unpalatable, so the right approach is to reduce the centralization bottleneck via incorporating all of this into Ethereum by a protocol better than the builder API.

author: tersec
content: One thing, then, is that the builder API should say, in writing, explicitly, that this _will_ happen

author: tersec
content: that the CL does not have to submit a block. Because right now it does not specify this, but now the relays are kind of sabotaging such efforts intentionally. Shouldn't do both simultaneously
